name: Robert Merz
text: Delicious made to order pizza that you can add as many ingredients or as little as you like for the same price around $9, as of this review.They also have their own line of specific ingredient pizzas you can choose from. The pizza is ok for ‚Ä¶More

text: Amazing location! The staff is very friendly and they go above and beyond to accommodate food allergies. They have the most reasonably priced Gluten free pizza I have found. My girlfriend has Celiac disease and she was able to have their ‚Ä¶More

text: this place is really good... did not hear it before and tried for the first time.... great pizza and free parking.... plenty of space inside and outside to dine in.

text: Pizza was made in less than 3 minutes, everything was fresh. Table were perfectly clean. Jim made the whole experience, an actual experience instead of just a visit to get food. He knew ahead of time exactly what kind of pizza I came in ‚Ä¶More

text: I order a lot from here. Deliver is faster than dominos. The pizza isn‚Äôt greasy here which is amazing, and toppings are very fresh. Reasonably priced. The crust is usually burnt on some parts but that is a good thing in my opinion because ‚Ä¶More

name: Leonel M
text: First let me say, I love Blaze Pizza. I think their pizzas are awesome. I'm wondering though if hygiene is a lost art? Watching the staff here not wash their hands after handling their phones, using a broom, handling cash, and then handling ‚Ä¶More

name: Anthony Folino
text: When you want a Neapolitan or a pizza made in a pizza oven this is not it. This is the Qdoba of pizza. It's fine but this is fast-food pizza.

name: Matthew Palmieri
text: The "subway" of pizza. Lots of ingredients to choose from. Good food, fast.

name: Shweta Raina
text: If you love thin crust pizza,  you will like Blaze. It is a chain pizza outlet and pretty much all over Chicago and the burbs. This particular chain is in downtown Highland Park, a stones throw from the Metra. You can build your own with ‚Ä¶More

name: James D'Angelo
text: This location in particular is great. Staff goes above and beyond. Pizza is really tasty. The single serve Pizza is huge and a great value. You get unlimited toppings which is great. Parking is pretty easy in downtown highland Park. Next to a DQ, which is great for dessert after a salty pizza.

name: Lars Lindgren
text: I love coming here! Service is awesome and consistent. Adam is phenomenal, he always asks how everything is and he is courteous and friendly. Definitely recommend!!!

name: juan reus
text: Create your own pizza concept. I loaded mine...chose a gluten free crust thinking it would be thinner.  Overall it was good - prefer more char on my crust.  Cost was about $14 with a drink.  Ate half there, half a few hours later.

name: Rahman W.
text: Great tasting thin crust pizza. Very customizable with your order and pretty reasonable prices. Highly recommend!

name: Laura Jerbi
text: Chose your crust...sauce...and from a vast array...your toppings.  Baked in a brick fire oven and then add a drizzle or something else.  OH SO GOOD!  Staff ready to assist and very friendly.  Roasted corn made my pizza super de lish.  The ‚Ä¶More
